intro: Melanoseris kashmiriana, commonly known as Kashmir violet, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are slender and upright. Melanoseris kashmiriana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
